message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

This paper deals with multi-class segmentation using convolutional neural networks, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV). The paper proposes a new loss function for this task, which involves probabilistic label spaces and the Wasserstein distance, indicating a focus on machine learning (cs.LG, cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of deep supervision, which is a common technique in neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper specifically applies its methods to brain tumour segmentation, which falls under medical imaging (cs.MM).
